newsitem.title: USA: U.S. House panel to hold inflation bond hearing.
newsitem.headline: U.S. House panel to hold inflation bond hearing.

text.p: The House Ways and Means Committee plans to hold a hearing on inflation-indexed bonds after the first Treasury auction, a spokesman said Wednesday.

Committee Chairman Bill Archer, R-Texas, has expressed concern about the bonds. No date was set yet for the hearing, which will discuss the first auction of the bonds scheduled for Jan. 29. The bonds are tied to movements in the consumer price index.
Archer met with Treasury Secretary Robert Rubin in a closed-door meeting Tuesday, but the spokesman would not comment on what was discussed.
